        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

Use a domain with HSTS enabled<span class="line"><!---->1. Use a domain with HSTS enabled<!----></span><br>2. Run a local instance of the development environment for instance <span class="line"><!---->2. Run a local instance of the development environment for instance <!----></span>https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost.DOMAIN.com"><!---->https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<!----></a> where the SSL is a self signed one with Common Name *.DOMAIN.com<span class="line"><!----> where the SSL is a self signed one with Common Name *.DOMAIN.com<!----></span><br>3. When visiting the <span class="line"><!---->3. When visiting the <!----></span>https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost.DOMAIN.com"><!---->https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<!----></a> the HSTS error for SSL is shown but this does not provide a "Proceed" link at the bottom similarly to standard SSL mismatch errors.<span class="line"><!----> the HSTS error for SSL is shown but this does not provide a "Proceed" link at the bottom similarly to standard SSL mismatch errors.<!----></span><br>4. Going to chrome://net-internals/#hsts and removing the domain temporarily fixes the problem but it eventually comes back blocking my use experience<span class="line"><!---->4. Going to chrome://net-internals/#hsts and removing the domain temporarily fixes the problem but it eventually comes back blocking my use experience<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>Despite HSTS behaviour allow users to skip error and establish a connection.<span class="line"><!---->Despite HSTS behaviour allow users to skip error and establish a connection.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>HSTS page blocks usage continuously <span class="line"><!---->HSTS page blocks usage continuously <!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 90.0.4430.72  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 90.0.4430.72  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS<!----></span><br>Flash Version:<span class="line"><!---->Flash Version:<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I believe Chromium is behaving as expected, see <span class="line"><!---->I believe Chromium is behaving as expected, see <!----></span>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1"><!---->https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1<!----></a> : No user recourse should be possible. i.e. there's no click through option in the interstitial because it is a serious security risk (see the introduction of that RFC). <span class="line"><!----> : No user recourse should be possible. i.e. there's no click through option in the interstitial because it is a serious security risk (see the introduction of that RFC). <!----></span><br>There is a way to still click through this interstitial, which is not advertised for obvious reasons (see <span class="line"><!---->There is a way to still click through this interstitial, which is not advertised for obvious reasons (see <!----></span>https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659"><!---->https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659<!----></a> ).<span class="line"><!----> ).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        That is very  disappointing, I added a comment on Stackoverflow but you are basically blocking developers from testing on Chrome. I am currently forced to use Firefox and I cannot test my software on Chrome<span class="line"><!---->That is very  disappointing, I added a comment on Stackoverflow but you are basically blocking developers from testing on Chrome. I am currently forced to use Firefox and I cannot test my software on Chrome<!----></span><br><br>Here is why <span class="line"><!---->Here is why <!----></span><br>1 - Chrome behaves differently from other browsers. Firefox does not impose such hideous block and lets "Developers/Users" choose. <span class="line"><!---->1 - Chrome behaves differently from other browsers. Firefox does not impose such hideous block and lets "Developers/Users" choose. <!----></span><br>2- you assume developers have always control over their development environments and thus what certificate is used and how it is provisioned. This is not the case. Developers need to allow self-signed certificates or they will just use another browser and will not be able to test local changes on Chrome. <span class="line"><!---->2- you assume developers have always control over their development environments and thus what certificate is used and how it is provisioned. This is not the case. Developers need to allow self-signed certificates or they will just use another browser and will not be able to test local changes on Chrome. <!----></span><br>3 - It is inconsistent that self-signed checks allows users to override them but not for the HSTS one. Why can users just click and ignore self-signed certificates warning when HSTS is disabled vs when it is not?<span class="line"><!---->3 - It is inconsistent that self-signed checks allows users to override them but not for the HSTS one. Why can users just click and ignore self-signed certificates warning when HSTS is disabled vs when it is not?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          margin-bottom: 0.25em;

          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;

    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>


      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      </button>

          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

Run a local instance of the development environment for instance <span class="line"><!---->2. When visiting the <span class="line"><!---->3.         hi Carlo, thanks for checking this.<span class="line"><!---->hi Carlo, thanks for checking this.<!----></span><br><br>The main domain replies with header max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload as described at point 1.<span class="line"><!---->The main domain replies with header max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload as described at point 1.<!----></span><br><br>At point 3 I am stuck because  Chrome does not let me the end user of the browser to override the policy as it does when there is a self-signed certificate.<span class="line"><!---->At point 3 I am stuck because  Chrome does not let me the end user of the browser to override the policy as it does when there is a self-signed certificate.<!----></span><br>Chrome just shows a page that will not let you get anywhere and just show the error.<span class="line"><!---->Chrome just shows a page that will not let you get anywhere and just show the error.<!----></span><br><br>This is not the same behaviour in other browsers I have tested with but certainly as a end user I would like to control what happens in this case. <span class="line"><!---->This is not the same behaviour in other browsers I have tested with but certainly as a end user I would like to control what happens in this case. <!----></span><br>Having Chrome show me a serious warning is great. But if Chrome blocks me from doing development then it is a blocker.<span class="line"><!---->Having Chrome show me a serious warning is great. But if Chrome blocks me from doing development then it is a blocker.<!----></span><br><br>I hope this clarifies it but do let me know if you have further questions.<span class="line"><!---->I hope this clarifies it but do let me know if you have further questions.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I believe Chromium is behaving as expected, see <span class="line"><!---->I believe Chromium is behaving as expected, see <!----></span>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1"><!---->https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1<!----></a> : No user recourse should be possible. i.e. there's no click through option in the interstitial because it is a serious security risk (see the introduction of that RFC). <span class="line"><!----> : No user recourse should be possible. i.e. there's no click through option in the interstitial because it is a serious security risk (see the introduction of that RFC). <!----></span><br>There is a way to still click through this interstitial, which is not advertised for obvious reasons (see <span class="line"><!---->There is a way to still click through this interstitial, which is not advertised for obvious reasons (see <!----></span>https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659"><!---->https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659<!----></a> ).<span class="line"><!----> ).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        That is very  disappointing, I added a comment on Stackoverflow but you are basically blocking developers from testing on Chrome. I am currently forced to use Firefox and I cannot test my software on Chrome<span class="line"><!---->That is very  disappointing, I added a comment on Stackoverflow but you are basically blocking developers from testing on Chrome. I am currently forced to use Firefox and I cannot test my software on Chrome<!----></span><br><br>Here is why <span class="line"><!---->Here is why <!----></span><br>1 - Chrome behaves differently from other browsers. Firefox does not impose such hideous block and lets "Developers/Users" choose. <span class="line"><!---->1 - Chrome behaves differently from other browsers. Firefox does not impose such hideous block and lets "Developers/Users" choose. <!----></span><br>2- you assume developers have always control over their development environments and thus what certificate is used and how it is provisioned. This is not the case. Developers need to allow self-signed certificates or they will just use another browser and will not be able to test local changes on Chrome. <span class="line"><!---->2- you assume developers have always control over their development environments and thus what certificate is used and how it is provisioned. This is not the case. Developers need to allow self-signed certificates or they will just use another browser and will not be able to test local changes on Chrome. <!----></span><br>3 - It is inconsistent that self-signed checks allows users to override them but not for the HSTS one. Why can users just click and ignore self-signed certificates warning when HSTS is disabled vs when it is not?<span class="line"><!---->3 - It is inconsistent that self-signed checks allows users to override them but not for the HSTS one. Why can users just click and ignore self-signed certificates warning when HSTS is disabled vs when it is not?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          </tbody>
        </table>

      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">

          </button>

      </chops-dialog>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

Use a domain with HSTS enabled<span class="line"><!---->1. Use a domain with HSTS enabled<!----></span><br>2. Run a local instance of the development environment for instance <span class="line"><!---->2. Run a local instance of the development environment for instance <!----></span>https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost.DOMAIN.com"><!---->https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<!----></a> where the SSL is a self signed one with Common Name *.DOMAIN.com<span class="line"><!----> where the SSL is a self signed one with Common Name *.DOMAIN.com<!----></span><br>3. When visiting the <span class="line"><!---->3. When visiting the <!----></span>https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost.DOMAIN.com"><!---->https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<!----></a> the HSTS error for SSL is shown but this does not provide a "Proceed" link at the bottom similarly to standard SSL mismatch errors.<span class="line"><!----> the HSTS error for SSL is shown but this does not provide a "Proceed" link at the bottom similarly to standard SSL mismatch errors.<!----></span><br>4. Going to chrome://net-internals/#hsts and removing the domain temporarily fixes the problem but it eventually comes back blocking my use experience<span class="line"><!---->4. Going to chrome://net-internals/#hsts and removing the domain temporarily fixes the problem but it eventually comes back blocking my use experience<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>Despite HSTS behaviour allow users to skip error and establish a connection.<span class="line"><!---->Despite HSTS behaviour allow users to skip error and establish a connection.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>HSTS page blocks usage continuously <span class="line"><!---->HSTS page blocks usage continuously <!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before?         hi Carlo, thanks for checking this.<span class="line"><!---->hi Carlo, thanks for checking this.<!----></span><br><br>The main domain replies with header max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload as described at point 1.<span class="line"><!---->The main domain replies with header max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload as described at point 1.<!----></span><br><br>At point 3 I am stuck because  Chrome does not let me the end user of the browser to override the policy as it does when there is a self-signed certificate.<span class="line"><!---->At point 3 I am stuck because  Chrome does not let me the end user of the browser to override the policy as it does when there is a self-signed certificate.<!----></span><br>Chrome just shows a page that will not let you get anywhere and just show the error.<span class="line"><!---->Chrome just shows a page that will not let you get anywhere and just show the error.<!----></span><br><br>This is not the same behaviour in other browsers I have tested with but certainly as a end user I would like to control what happens in this case. <span class="line"><!---->This is not the same behaviour in other browsers I have tested with but certainly as a end user I would like to control what happens in this case. <!----></span><br>Having Chrome show me a serious warning is great. But if Chrome blocks me from doing development then it is a blocker.<span class="line"><!---->Having Chrome show me a serious warning is great. But if Chrome blocks me from doing development then it is a blocker.<!----></span><br><br>I hope this clarifies it but do let me know if you have further questions.<span class="line"><!---->I hope this clarifies it but do let me know if you have further questions.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I believe Chromium is behaving as expected, see <span class="line"><!---->I believe Chromium is behaving as expected, see <!----></span>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1"><!---->https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1<!----></a> : No user recourse should be possible. i.e. there's no click through option in the interstitial because it is a serious security risk (see the introduction of that RFC). <span class="line"><!----> : No user recourse should be possible. i.e. there's no click through option in the interstitial because it is a serious security risk (see the introduction of that RFC). <!----></span><br>There is a way to still click through this interstitial, which is not advertised for obvious reasons (see <span class="line"><!---->There is a way to still click through this interstitial, which is not advertised for obvious reasons (see <!----></span>https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659"><!---->https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659<!----></a> ).<span class="line"><!----> ).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        That is very  disappointing, I added a comment on Stackoverflow but you are basically blocking developers from testing on Chrome. I am currently forced to use Firefox and I cannot test my software on Chrome<span class="line"><!---->That is very  disappointing, I added a comment on Stackoverflow but you are basically blocking developers from testing on Chrome. I am currently forced to use Firefox and I cannot test my software on Chrome<!----></span><br><br>Here is why <span class="line"><!---->Here is why <!----></span><br>1 - Chrome behaves differently from other browsers. Firefox does not impose such hideous block and lets "Developers/Users" choose. <span class="line"><!---->1 - Chrome behaves differently from other browsers. Firefox does not impose such hideous block and lets "Developers/Users" choose. <!----></span><br>2- you assume developers have always control over their development environments and thus what certificate is used and how it is provisioned. This is not the case. Developers need to allow self-signed certificates or they will just use another browser and will not be able to test local changes on Chrome. <span class="line"><!---->2- you assume developers have always control over their development environments and thus what certificate is used and how it is provisioned. This is not the case. Developers need to allow self-signed certificates or they will just use another browser and will not be able to test local changes on Chrome. <!----></span><br>3 - It is inconsistent that self-signed checks allows users to override them but not for the HSTS one. Why can users just click and ignore self-signed certificates warning when HSTS is disabled vs when it is not?<span class="line"><!---->3 - It is inconsistent that self-signed checks allows users to override them but not for the HSTS one. Why can users just click and ignore self-signed certificates warning when HSTS is disabled vs when it is not?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

            </chops-button>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

        .container-no-issue {

          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

          min-width: 256px;

          flex-shrink: 0;

          width: 100%;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

Use a domain with HSTS enabled<span class="line"><!---->1. Use a domain with HSTS enabled<!----></span><br>2. Run a local instance of the development environment for instance <span class="line"><!---->2. Run a local instance of the development environment for instance <!----></span>https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost.DOMAIN.com"><!---->https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<!----></a> where the SSL is a self signed one with Common Name *.DOMAIN.com<span class="line"><!----> where the SSL is a self signed one with Common Name *.DOMAIN.com<!----></span><br>3. When visiting the <span class="line"><!---->3. When visiting the <!----></span>https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost.DOMAIN.com"><!---->https://localhost.DOMAIN.com<!----></a> the HSTS error for SSL is shown but this does not provide a "Proceed" link at the bottom similarly to standard SSL mismatch errors.<span class="line"><!----> the HSTS error for SSL is shown but this does not provide a "Proceed" link at the bottom similarly to standard SSL mismatch errors.<!----></span><br>4. Going to chrome://net-internals/#hsts and removing the domain temporarily fixes the problem but it eventually comes back blocking my use experience<span class="line"><!---->4. Going to chrome://net-internals/#hsts and removing the domain temporarily fixes the problem but it eventually comes back blocking my use experience<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>Despite HSTS behaviour allow users to skip error and establish a connection.<span class="line"><!---->Despite HSTS behaviour allow users to skip error and establish a connection.<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>HSTS page blocks usage continuously <span class="line"><!---->HSTS page blocks usage continuously <!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before?         hi Carlo, thanks for checking this.<span class="line"><!---->hi Carlo, thanks for checking this.<!----></span><br><br>The main domain replies with header max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload as described at point 1.<span class="line"><!---->The main domain replies with header max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload as described at point 1.<!----></span><br><br>At point 3 I am stuck because  Chrome does not let me the end user of the browser to override the policy as it does when there is a self-signed certificate.<span class="line"><!---->At point 3 I am stuck because  Chrome does not let me the end user of the browser to override the policy as it does when there is a self-signed certificate.<!----></span><br>Chrome just shows a page that will not let you get anywhere and just show the error.<span class="line"><!---->Chrome just shows a page that will not let you get anywhere and just show the error.<!----></span><br><br>This is not the same behaviour in other browsers I have tested with but certainly as a end user I would like to control what happens in this case. <span class="line"><!---->This is not the same behaviour in other browsers I have tested with but certainly as a end user I would like to control what happens in this case. <!----></span><br>Having Chrome show me a serious warning is great. But if Chrome blocks me from doing development then it is a blocker.<span class="line"><!---->Having Chrome show me a serious warning is great. But if Chrome blocks me from doing development then it is a blocker.<!----></span><br><br>I hope this clarifies it but do let me know if you have further questions.<span class="line"><!---->I hope this clarifies it but do let me know if you have further questions.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I believe Chromium is behaving as expected, see <span class="line"><!---->I believe Chromium is behaving as expected, see <!----></span>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1"><!---->https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1<!----></a> : No user recourse should be possible. i.e. there's no click through option in the interstitial because it is a serious security risk (see the introduction of that RFC). <span class="line"><!----> : No user recourse should be possible. i.e. there's no click through option in the interstitial because it is a serious security risk (see the introduction of that RFC). <!----></span><br>There is a way to still click through this interstitial, which is not advertised for obvious reasons (see <span class="line"><!---->There is a way to still click through this interstitial, which is not advertised for obvious reasons (see <!----></span>https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659"><!---->https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659<!----></a> ).<span class="line"><!----> ).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        That is very  disappointing, I added a comment on Stackoverflow but you are basically blocking developers from testing on Chrome. I am currently forced to use Firefox and I cannot test my software on Chrome<span class="line"><!---->That is very  disappointing, I added a comment on Stackoverflow but you are basically blocking developers from testing on Chrome. I am currently forced to use Firefox and I cannot test my software on Chrome<!----></span><br><br>Here is why <span class="line"><!---->Here is why <!----></span><br>1 - Chrome behaves differently from other browsers. Firefox does not impose such hideous block and lets "Developers/Users" choose. <span class="line"><!---->1 - Chrome behaves differently from other browsers. Firefox does not impose such hideous block and lets "Developers/Users" choose. <!----></span><br>2- you assume developers have always control over their development environments and thus what certificate is used and how it is provisioned. This is not the case. Developers need to allow self-signed certificates or they will just use another browser and will not be able to test local changes on Chrome. <span class="line"><!---->2- you assume developers have always control over their development environments and thus what certificate is used and how it is provisioned. This is not the case. Developers need to allow self-signed certificates or they will just use another browser and will not be able to test local changes on Chrome. <!----></span><br>3 - It is inconsistent that self-signed checks allows users to override them but not for the HSTS one. Why can users just click and ignore self-signed certificates warning when HSTS is disabled vs when it is not?<span class="line"><!---->3 - It is inconsistent that self-signed checks allows users to override them but not for the HSTS one. Why can users just click and ignore self-signed certificates warning when HSTS is disabled vs when it is not?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1200811: HSTS warning page blocks domains even if whitelisted for insecure use
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1200811: HSTS warning page blocks domains even if whitelisted for insecure use
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      diego...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/992369929" title="diego...@gmail.com"><!---->diego...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      diego...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->diego...@gmail.com<!----></span>

        hi Carlo, thanks for checking this.<span class="line"><!---->hi Carlo, thanks for checking this.<!----></span><br><br>The main domain replies with header max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload as described at point 1.<span class="line"><!---->The main domain replies with header max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload as described at point 1.<!----></span><br><br>At point 3 I am stuck because  Chrome does not let me the end user of the browser to override the policy as it does when there is a self-signed certificate.<span class="line"><!---->At point 3 I am stuck because  Chrome does not let me the end user of the browser to override the policy as it does when there is a self-signed certificate.<!----></span><br>Chrome just shows a page that will not let you get anywhere and just show the error.<span class="line"><!---->Chrome just shows a page that will not let you get anywhere and just show the error.<!----></span><br><br>This is not the same behaviour in other browsers I have tested with but certainly as a end user I would like to control what happens in this case. <span class="line"><!---->This is not the same behaviour in other browsers I have tested with but certainly as a end user I would like to control what happens in this case. <!----></span><br>Having Chrome show me a serious warning is great. But if Chrome blocks me from doing development then it is a blocker.<span class="line"><!---->Having Chrome show me a serious warning is great. But if Chrome blocks me from doing development then it is a blocker.<!----></span><br><br>I hope this clarifies it but do let me know if you have further questions.<span class="line"><!---->I hope this clarifies it but do let me know if you have further questions.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I believe Chromium is behaving as expected, see <span class="line"><!---->I believe Chromium is behaving as expected, see <!----></span>https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1"><!---->https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6797#section-12.1<!----></a> : No user recourse should be possible. i.e. there's no click through option in the interstitial because it is a serious security risk (see the introduction of that RFC). <span class="line"><!----> : No user recourse should be possible. i.e. there's no click through option in the interstitial because it is a serious security risk (see the introduction of that RFC). <!----></span><br>There is a way to still click through this interstitial, which is not advertised for obvious reasons (see <span class="line"><!---->There is a way to still click through this interstitial, which is not advertised for obvious reasons (see <!----></span>https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659"><!---->https://stackoverflow.com/q/35274659<!----></a> ).<span class="line"><!----> ).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        That is very  disappointing, I added a comment on Stackoverflow but you are basically blocking developers from testing on Chrome. I am currently forced to use Firefox and I cannot test my software on Chrome<span class="line"><!---->That is very  disappointing, I added a comment on Stackoverflow but you are basically blocking developers from testing on Chrome. I am currently forced to use Firefox and I cannot test my software on Chrome<!----></span><br><br>Here is why <span class="line"><!---->Here is why <!----></span><br>1 - Chrome behaves differently from other browsers. Firefox does not impose such hideous block and lets "Developers/Users" choose. <span class="line"><!---->1 - Chrome behaves differently from other browsers. Firefox does not impose such hideous block and lets "Developers/Users" choose. <!----></span><br>2- you assume developers have always control over their development environments and thus what certificate is used and how it is provisioned. This is not the case. Developers need to allow self-signed certificates or they will just use another browser and will not be able to test local changes on Chrome. <span class="line"><!---->2- you assume developers have always control over their development environments and thus what certificate is used and how it is provisioned. This is not the case. Developers need to allow self-signed certificates or they will just use another browser and will not be able to test local changes on Chrome. <!----></span><br>3 - It is inconsistent that self-signed checks allows users to override them but not for the HSTS one. Why can users just click and ignore self-signed certificates warning when HSTS is disabled vs when it is not?<span class="line"><!---->3 - It is inconsistent that self-signed checks allows users to override them but not for the HSTS one. Why can users just click and ignore self-signed certificates warning when HSTS is disabled vs when it is not?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        hi Carlo, thanks for checking this.<span class="line"><!---->hi Carlo, thanks for checking this.<!----></span><br><br>The main domain replies with header max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload as described at point 1.<span class="line"><!---->The main domain replies with header max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload as described at point 1.<!----></span><br><br>At point 3 I am stuck because  Chrome does not let me the end user of the browser to override the policy as it does when there is a self-signed certificate.<span class="line"><!---->At point 3 I am stuck because  Chrome does not let me the end user of the browser to override the policy as it does when there is a self-signed certificate.<!----></span><br>Chrome just shows a page that will not let you get anywhere and just show the error.<span class="line"><!---->Chrome just shows a page that will not let you get anywhere and just show the error.<!----></span><br><br>This is not the same behaviour in other browsers I have tested with but certainly as a end user I would like to control what happens in this case. <span class="line"><!---->This is not the same behaviour in other browsers I have tested with but certainly as a end user I would like to control what happens in this case. <!----></span><br>Having Chrome show me a serious warning is great. But if Chrome blocks me from doing development then it is a blocker.<span class="line"><!---->Having Chrome show me a serious warning is great. But if Chrome blocks me from doing development then it is a blocker.<!----></span><br><br>I hope this clarifies it but do let me know if you have further questions.<span class="line"><!---->I hope this clarifies it but do let me know if you have further questions.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
